#Text=Westhill
#Text=Westhill is a town in Aberdeenshire .
#Text=Understand
#Text=Westhill is a town lying approximately to the west of Aberdeen .
#Text=The town was planned and built on former farmland in the 1970s and continued to develop primarily as a commuter town , however a small industrial park was developed .
#Text=Recent investment has seen considerable growth in the commercial and industrial sector and the industrial park has grown considerably .
#Text=By car
#Text=The A944 Aberdeen to Alford road passes through Westhill .
#Text=The road is largely dual 2-lane carriageway into Aberdeen , with a journey time of approximately 20 – 30 minutes , and a decent single 2-lane carriageway west .
#Text=The B9119 runs immediately south of the industrial park and provides a route to Banchory and Deeside .
#Text=The B979 , which skirts the west and north , runs both south to Stonehaven via Peterculter and north to the airport/Dyce via the A96 .
#Text=By train
#Text=Westhill is not served by rail services .
#Text=The nearest station is Aberdeen from which both buses or taxis can be taken .
#Text=Dyce station is a viable alternative to Aberdeen if coming in from the Aberdeen to Inverness line , however there are no bus services , only taxis .
#Text=By bus
#Text=Westhill is served well by buses .
#Text=Stagecoach buses run the frequent X17 " express " service between Aberdeen and Westhill , which runs through the west end of Aberdeen and straight out the main road .
#Text=Journey times are approximately 30 minutes with a daytime frequency of 12 minutes .
#Text=Services begin at Aberdeen Bus Station from approximately 5:35AM with the last bus departing at 11:35PM .
#Text=Evening and Sunday frequency is between 1 and 2 buses per hour .

#Text=Further journey options between Aberdeen and Westhill exist in the form of the 218 , which runs a more circuitous route through Kingswells , Summerhill and Aberdeen Royal Infirmary , journey time approximately 60 minutes .
#Text=Services on this route have been largely cut in the recent ( April 2012 ) timetable and run to a frequency of one bus every 2½ hours .
#Text=Please consult timetables if using this service to avoid a long wait .
#Text=This service does not run on a Sunday .
#Text=Services are largely on modern and comfortable buses , albeit at a high price .
#Text=Buses depart from Aberdeen between 5:30AM and 11:30PM on various routes .

#Text=Travellers should pay attention to the service number in order to save a long journey or even missing the town completely ( it can be a long walk from Elrick to the hotels in the cold ! ) Night Services run on Saturday and Sunday mornings between 12:20AM and 3:20AM with a higher price ( £5 flat fare as of April 2012 ) .

#Text=Westhill can also be reached by bus from Alford direction on the 218 service and from Ballater direction on the 210 service ( there is also a rush hour only service to/from Banchory under the same number ) .
#Text=Buses run infrequently on the 218 and extremely sparsely on the 210 ; neither service runs on Sundays .
#Text=There is a rush hour-only bus service , 777 operated by Bains Coaches , between Oldmeldrum/Inverurie and the airport .
#Text=By car
#Text=There is no real need to drive due to the small size of town , however should you choose to do so , you can enjoy roads with light traffic and free parking all over town .
#Text=By bicycle
#Text=Westhill is cycle friendly , all main roads have cycle lanes painted on them and an abundance of mixed cycle and footpaths provides for an excellent off-road alternative .
#Text=By bus

#Text=Locals do not appear to use the bus to travel within the town ( a town service ran for a very brief period of time but was withdrawn due to lack of patronage ) , however the service 218 links the industrial park , hotels , pubs , shops and golf course with the residential areas .
#Text=This service runs relatively infrequently ( one bus per 2½ hours approximately ) and may not prove a viable option .

#Text=It may be more prudent to source a taxi , most premises have telephone numbers and a public pay phone for them or at times , taxis can be found parked adjacent to the veterinary surgery behind the shopping centre .
#Text=By foot
#Text=Westhill is small enough to navigate on foot for visitors .
#Text=Some newer housing areas are a considerable distance away but are unlikely to be of attraction to visitors .
#Text=See
#Text=Being primarily a commuter town , there are no " sights " to see in Westhill as such , but there are opportunities for scenic photography .
#Text=Loch of Skene .
#Text=Site of Special Scientific Interest
#Text=Do
#Text=For the same reasons above , there are not many activities within the town .
#Text=However , the Westhill Golf Course is worth a visit and there are also tennis courts , a bowling green and a swimming pool .
#Text=The layout of the town is also friendly for runners .
#Text=Buy
#Text=Nearby supermarkets include Tesco , Marks & Spencers , the Co-op and Costco .
#Text=The Farmers Market is held here first Saturday of the month 09:00 - 13:00 at Ashdale Hall .
#Text=Eat
#Text=Westhill has been spoiled in recent years by new places to eat .
#Text=Jimmy Chung 's - Westhill Drive . 01224 749200 .
#Text=Located beside Aldi , this is a Chinese buffet outlet serving most types of dishes .
#Text=Is pretty economical pricewise but you get what you pay for .
#Text=Key West - Unit 17 , Westhill Shopping Centre , Old Skene Road .
#Text=Cafe/bar serving typical bar fare .
#Text=Max 's - Ashdale Drive . 01224 766159 .
#Text=An excellent outlet with a full service Italian restaurant , a takeaway pizzeria and a coffee shop .
#Text=Yan Oriental - Ashdale Drive . 01224 746746 .
#Text=A full service oriental .
#Text=Considerably pricier but better quality than Jimmy Chungs .
#Text=Broadstraik Inn - A944 , Elrick .
#Text=Has a full service restaurant and separate bar serving bar food .
#Text=Decent quality but overpriced .
#Text=Shepherd 's Rest - A944 , Westhill . 01224 740208 .
#Text=Serves " Brewer 's Fayre " type food .

column1: #Text=Very good quality and at good prices with large portions .
#Text=A better alternative to the Broadstraik Inn .
#Text=Subway - Ashdale Drive .
#Text=Not that it needs any introduction , but serves sub sandwiches typical of the international chain .
#Text=Szechuan Chinese Takeaway - Westhill Shopping Centre .
#Text=Average quality Chinese takeaway .
#Text=Taste of India - Westhill Shopping Centre .
#Text=Good quality Indian takeaway .
#Text=Hong Kong Express - Unit 11 , Enterprise Drive , Westhill Industrial Estate .
#Text=Poor quality Chinese takeaway .
#Text=Drink
#Text=Westhill has a basic night life with no clubs to speak of , however there are a number of bars each with their own character .
#Text=Drinks are not cheap and expect to pay £3-4 for a pint .
#Text=With the exception of The Shepherds Rest , all bars have satellite television and show a variety of sporting events .
#Text=Broadstraik Inn - A944 Aberdeen - Alford Road - A traditional roadside inn .
#Text=In addition to the restaurant the inn is split into two separate bar sections .
#Text=The front bar is more akin to a lounge with log fires , wood tables and high backed chairs .
#Text=The rear section functions as the " bar " with a pool table ( the only one in Westhill ) , darts , jukebox and large screen television and is by far the livelier area .
#Text=Sizeable beer garden and play area for children .
#Text=Open Su - Th till 11PM , W Th till midnight , F till 1AM , and Sa till 12:30AM .
#Text=Shepherds Rest - A944 Aberdeen - Alford Road - Decked out as a traditional roadside inn ( albet , relatively new ) and has a relaxing atmosphere .
#Text=Although it functions primarily as a restaurant , it is possible to visit purely for a drink .

#Text=Previously the only premises where one could drink a variety of hand pulled cask ales , however these have since disappeared following the purchase of the premises by Belhaven Breweries which has resulted in their products dominating .
#Text=A television exists at the rear of the bar and shows sports on terrestrial television .
#Text=Open Su - Th till 11PM , F Sa till midnight .

#Text=Key West - Westhill Shopping Centre - Potentially the " weekend hotspot " and popular with the locals , particularly during football events ( during which they may bring the big screen into play ) .

column1: #Text=Has a slight sterile feel to it but is otherwise a nice place to go and has a good draft beer selection .
#Text=Generally features a DJ on Friday & Saturday nights till closing time and the middle area becomes a dance floor .
#Text=Located next door to Westhill 's only kebab shop which stays open just past closing time .
#Text=Open Su till 11:30PM , M - Th till midnight , F Sa till 1AM .
